alert.note: Alert for Bracken (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 03 at 7:35AM EST until January 03 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Kentucky and Ohio, including the following counties, in Kentucky, Bracken, Lewis, Mason and Robertson. In Ohio, Adams and Brown. * WHEN...Until 945 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 735 AM EST, radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Maysville, Washington, West Union, Manchester, Ripley, Aberdeen, Vanceburg, Augusta, Lewisburg, Brooksville, Tollesboro, Rome, Mount Olivet, Dover, Germantown, Sardis, Concord, Somo and Orangeburg.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
